source_sentence: ◎佛說睒子經
translation: Śāriputra's Commentary

source_sentence: 姚秦三藏法師釋聖堅譯
translation: Translated by Shi Shengjian, Master of the Yao-Qin Tripiṭaka

source_sentence: 聞如是：一時，佛在毘羅勒國，與千二百五十比丘，及眾菩薩、國王、大臣、長者、居士、清信、士女不可稱計，一時來會。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was in the country of Vairocana with 1,250 monks and an incalculable number of bodhisattvas, kings, ministers, elders, householders, pure faith, and women who had come together at one time.

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘：「皆處定意聽！
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "Set your minds and listen!

source_sentence: 我前世，初得菩薩道時，戒行普具，精進一心，修集智慧，善權方便，功德累積不可稱計，諸天龍、鬼神、帝王、人民無能行者。」
translation: In a previous life, when I first attained the bodhisattva path, my moral conduct was complete, my effort was single-minded, I cultivated wisdom, I had good authority and skillful means, and I accumulated incalculable merit that no gods, dragons, spirits, emperors, or people could perform."

source_sentence: 阿難聞佛言，更正衣服，長跪叉手，白佛言：「願欲所聞。」
translation: On hearing the Buddha's words, Ānanda adjusted his robes, knelt down with his palms together, and said to the Buddha, "I wish to hear what he's heard."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「乃往過去無數世，時有菩薩名曰一切妙行，慈仁惠施，救濟群生，常行四等心，度世危難，育養苦人。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "There was a bodhisattva from countless ages in the past who was named Sarvâstivāda, who was kind and generous, saved all sentient beings, always practiced the four kinds of equanimity, saved the world from distress, and nurtured suffering people.

source_sentence: 在兜率天上教授天人，常以晝夜各三時定意，思惟三昧，照觀十方天下、人民善惡之道。
translation: He taught gods and humans on Tuṣita Heaven, always concentrating his mind three times a day and three times a night, contemplating samādhi, and observing the world and the good and bad ways of its people in the ten directions.

source_sentence: 知有父子，孝順父母，奉事三尊，恭順師長修諸功德者，常以天眼遍觀五道。
translation: They know that there are fathers and sons who are dutiful to their parents, serve the three honored ones, and cultivate merit in deference to their teachers, and they always observe the five destinies with the divine eye.

source_sentence: 「時，有迦夷國，中有一長者孤無兒子，夫婦兩目皆盲，心願入山求無上道決，修清淨志，信樂空閑。
translation: "At the time, there was an elder in the country of Kāśī who was orphaned, had no son, and a husband and wife who were blind in both eyes, wished to enter the mountains to seek the unsurpassed path, cultivated a pure intention, and believed in and enjoyed emptiness.

source_sentence: 菩薩念言：『此人發意欲學妙道，而兩目皆盲，目無所覩，若入山中或墮溝坑，或逢毒蟲所見危害。
translation: The bodhisattva thought, 'This person has aroused the desire to train in the wondrous way, but both eyes are blind, and they can't see anything; if they enter a mountain, they might fall into a ditch or encounter a poisonous insect that would harm their vision.

source_sentence: 若我壽終為其作子，供養父母終其年壽。』
translation: If I were to become his son at the end of my life, I would support my parents for the rest of their lives.'

source_sentence: 於是菩薩壽盡，即便下生盲父母家，為其作子。
translation: When his life span is up, the bodhisattva is born into the home of his blind parents and creates sons for them.

source_sentence: 父母歡喜愛之甚重，本發道意欲行入山，以生子故便樂世間。
translation: The parents were so delighted and fond of him that they had originally intended to travel into the mountains and were happy in the world because they had given birth to a son.

source_sentence: 「子年十歲號曰睒子，至孝仁慈，奉行十善：不殺、不盜、不婬、不欺、不飲酒、不妄言、不綺語、不嫉妬、信道不疑、晝夜精進，奉事父母如人事天，言常含笑不傷人意，行則應法不望傾斜，於是父母即大喜悅，無復憂愁。
translation: "When he was ten years old, the son was called Śāriputra, who was extremely filial and kind, practiced the ten good qualities: don't kill, don't steal, don't engage in sexual misconduct, don't deceive, don't drink alcohol, don't speak falsely, don't engage in harsh speech, don't be jealous, believe in the Way, don't doubt, make effort day and night, serve his parents as if they were gods, always speak with a smile that doesn't hurt people's feelings, and act in accord with the Dharma without expecting to be tilted, so his parents were greatly delighted and had no more sorrow.

source_sentence: 「至年過十歲，睒自長跪，白父母言：『本發大意欲入深山，志求空寂無上之道，豈以子故而絕本願。
translation: "When he was more than ten years old, he knelt down quietly and said to his parents, 'I had originally had the great intention of going into the deep mountains with the intention of seeking the unsurpassed path of emptiness and quiescence, but is it because of my son that I've cut off my original vow?'

source_sentence: 人居世間無常百變，命非金石對至無期，願如本意宜本先志，自隨父母俱共入山侍養之，宜不失時節。』
translation: Since people live in the world, which is impermanent and ever-changing, and since life is not made of metal or stone, there's no time to reach it, so I hope it's best to follow my parents into the mountains with my original intention and nurture them, so that I don't lose track of time.'

source_sentence: 父母報睒言：『子之孝順天自知之，不違本誓，便當入山。』
translation: The parents told Cao, 'God knows how filial and obedient their son is; if he doesn't violate this vow, he'll enter the mountain.'

source_sentence: 睒即以家中所有之物，皆施國中諸貧窮者，便與父母俱共入山。
translation: He then gave all the things he had at home to the poor people of his country, and went with his parents into the mountains.

source_sentence: 「睒子至山中，以蒲草為父母作屋，施置床褥，不寒不熱恒得其宜。
translation: "When he arrived in the mountains, he made a house for his parents out of bushes and grass and provided them with a bed and a mat that was always suitable, whether it was cold or hot.

source_sentence: 適入山一年眾果豐美，食之香甘，泉水涌出清而且涼；池中蓮華五色精明，栴檀雜香，樹木豐茂，香倍於常。
translation: A year after he entered the mountain, there was an abundance of delicious fruit that smelled good when eaten, and the spring water welled up clear and cool; the lotus in the pond was bright and five-colored, the sandalwood was fragrant, and the trees were abundant and smelled twice as good as usual.

source_sentence: 風雨以時，不寒不熱，樹葉相接，以障雨露，蔭覆日光，其下常涼。
translation: When it's raining and winding, it's neither cold nor hot, and the leaves of the trees are joined together to keep out rain and dew and to cover the sun, so it's always cool underneath.

source_sentence: 飛鳥翔集，皆作妓樂之音，以娛樂盲父母；師子、熊羆、虎狼、毒蟲，皆自慈心相向，無驚害之心，皆飲水、噉果無復驚怖之心，麞鹿、眾鳥皆來附近，與睒音聲相和，以娛樂盲父母。
translation: Flying birds gather, each making a musical sound to entertain their blind parents; lions, bears, tigers, wolves, and venomous insects all kindly face each other without fear or harm, each drinking water and devouring fruit without fear, and all the deer and birds come near, blending in with the glowing sounds to entertain their blind parents.

source_sentence: 睒至孝仁慈無有過，蹈地常恐地痛，天神、山神皆作人形，晝夜慰勞三道人，一心定意無復憂愁。
translation: He is most dutiful and kind without fault, always fearing pain when he steps on the ground, and the gods of the gods and mountains all take on human forms to comfort people of the three paths day and night, concentrating their minds without further sorrow.

source_sentence: 「睒常與父母取百種果蓏以食父母。
translation: "He always takes a hundred kinds of fruit and vegetables with his parents to feed them.

source_sentence: 父母時渴欲飲，睒著鹿皮衣提瓶行取水，麋鹿、飛鳥亦復往飲，不相畏難。
translation: When his parents were thirsty and wanted to drink, he put on a deerskin robe and carried a flask to get water, and moose and flying birds also went to drink, without any fear or embarrassment.

source_sentence: 時，迦夷國王入山射獵，王見水邊有麋鹿、飛鳥，引弓射之，箭誤中睒。
translation: When the king of Kāśyapa went into the mountains to hunt, he saw an elk or a flying bird near the water, drew his bow and shot them, and the arrow accidentally struck Cao.

source_sentence: 睒被毒箭甚痛，便大呼言：『誰持一毒箭，射殺三道人？』
translation: He was so pained by the poisoned arrow that he cried out, 'Who took a poisoned arrow and shot three people of the Way?'

source_sentence: 王聞人聲，下馬往到睒前，睒謂王言：『象坐牙死，犀坐角死，翠坐毛死，麋鹿坐皮死，今我死無牙、無角、無毛、無皮肉、不可噉，今有何罪橫見射殺？』
translation: When the king heard the sound of the people, he dismounted from his horse and went to Śākyamuni, who said to the king, 'An elephant dies while sitting on its tusks, a rhinoceros dies while sitting on its horns, a kingfisher dies while sitting on its hair, and an elk dies while sitting on its hide; now I'm dead without tusks, horns, hair, skin, or flesh, and I can't be devoured; what crime have I committed now that I've been shot dead by a stranger?'

source_sentence: 王言：『卿是何人？
translation: The king said, 'Who are you?'

source_sentence: 被鹿皮之衣與禽獸無異。』
translation: Clad in deerskin, he's no different from an animal.'

source_sentence: 睒言：『我是王國中人，與盲父母俱來學道，二十餘年未曾為虎狼毒蟲所害，今便為王箭所射殺之。』
translation: Cao said, 'I'm a native of the kingdom who came with my blind parents to train on the path, and I haven't been harmed by tigers, wolves, or venomous insects for more than 20 years.

source_sentence: 「當爾之時，山中大風暴起，吹折樹木，飛鳥、禽獸、師子、熊羆、虎狼、毒獸皆號呼動一山中；日無精光，流泉為竭，眾華萎死，雷電動地。
translation: "At the time, a great wind arose in the mountains, breaking down trees, and sending birds, animals, lions, beasts, tigers, wolves, and venomous creatures wailing and shouting throughout the mountains; the sun had no light, the fountains ran dry, the flowers withered and died, and thunderstorms struck the ground.

source_sentence: 時，盲父母即自驚起曰：『是何變異？
translation: The blind parents then startled themselves and got up, saying, 'What's the transformation?'

source_sentence: 睒行取水經久不還，將無為毒蟲之所害耶？
translation: Wouldn't the glittering buddha who takes water and doesn't return after a long time be harmed by poisonous insects?

source_sentence: 禽獸悲鳴，音聲號呼不如常時，風起四面樹木催折，必有災異。』
translation: When animals and birds cry out in lamentation and their voices call out differently than usual, and a wind rises and breaks trees on all sides, there's bound to be trouble.'

source_sentence: 王時怖懼大自悔責：『我本射鹿，箭誤傷中射殺道人，其罪甚重，坐貪少肉而受重殃；我今以一國財寶、宮殿、妓女、丘郭、城邑、以救子命。』
translation: Then, terrified, the king greatly repented, 'I was shooting at a deer and my arrow accidentally struck and killed a Wayfarer, which is a terrible sin; I sat there craving a little meat and received a terrible punishment; now, I'm saving my son's life with the treasures of a country, a palace, a prostitute, a hill and a city.'

source_sentence: 「時，王便前以手拔睒胸箭，箭深不可得出，飛鳥、禽獸四面雲集，悲鳴呼喚動一山中。
translation: "The king then used his hand to remove the arrow from his beak, but it was too deep to reach, and birds and beasts gathered on all sides, wailing and shouting lamentably as it stirred up a mountain.

source_sentence: 王益怖懅，支節皆動，睒言：『非王之過！
translation: The king became increasingly frightened, and his limbs all shook.

source_sentence: 我自宿罪所致，我不惜身命，但憐我盲父母，年既衰老，目無所見，一旦無我亦當終歿，以此懊惱酷毒耳。』
translation: 'My past sins have caused me to not pity myself or my life, but I pity my blind parents, who are elderly and don't see with their eyes, and who will end up dead once they lack self, because of this terrible pain.'

source_sentence: 當爾之時，諸天、龍神皆為肅動。
translation: At that point, the gods and dragons and goddesses were all agitated.

source_sentence: 王便重言：『我寧入泥犁中，百劫受罪，使睒身活。』
translation: The king then repeated, 'I'd rather go into the mire and suffer a hundred eons of punishment so that Glittering's body will live.'

source_sentence: 長跪向睒悔過：『若睒命終，我當不復還國，便住山中，供養卿盲父母，如卿在時，勿得為念，天龍、鬼神皆當證知，我不負此誓。』
translation: He knelt down and repented to Cao: 'If Cao's life ends, I will never return to my country and will stay in the mountains to support your blind parents; don't think about it while you're here; the gods, dragons, and spirits will all realize that I won't be held responsible for this vow.'

source_sentence: 「睒聞王此誓：『雖被毒箭，心喜意悅，雖死不恨，以我父母累王供養，王當罪滅，得福無量。』
translation: "Śākyamuni heard the king's vow, 'Although I was shot by a poisoned arrow, my heart rejoiced, and although I died, I didn't hate you; because my parents burdened the king with offerings, the king's sins will be extinguished, and I'll obtain immeasurable merit.'

source_sentence: 王言：『卿語我父母處，及子未絕吾欲知之。』
translation: The king said, 'I'd like to know what you said about my parents and where my son has yet to die.'

source_sentence: 睒即指示：『從此步徑去是不遠，自當見草屋，父母在其中止。
translation: He then instructed him, 'It's not far from this footpath, and I'll see a straw hut where my parents are staying.

source_sentence: 王徐徐往，勿令我父母驚動怖懅，以善方便解語其意，王當為我上白父母，我無常今至，當就後世。
translation: The king will explain to my parents that I'm impermanent and will pass on to a later life.

source_sentence: 我不惜身命，但憐我盲父母，年已衰老，目無所見，一旦無我無所依仰，以此懊惱自酷毒耳。
translation: I don't spare my life, but I pity my blind parents, who are elderly and have no vision, and once they lack a self and have nothing to look up to, this will be a painful experience for them.

source_sentence: 我死自分宿罪所致，無可得脫，今自懺悔，從無數劫有身以來，所行眾惡，於此罪滅，願與父母世世相值，不相遠離，當令父母終保年壽，勿有憂患，天龍、鬼神常隨護助，災害消滅，所欲應意無為自然。』
translation: Now, I confess that since I began to exist in the body countless eons ago, I've done numerous bad deeds, and now that these sins have ceased, I wish to be with my parents from generation to generation and not be separated from them, so that my parents will live to the end of their lives and not be troubled, that gods, dragons, and ghosts will always be there to protect them, that calamities will cease, and that whatever I want will come naturally.'

source_sentence: 「王將數人詣父母所，王去之後，睒奄死矣。
translation: "The king sent several people to their parents' home, and after he left, Di An died.

source_sentence: 百鳥、禽獸四面雲集，皆大號呼，繞睒屍上，舐是胸血。
translation: A hundred birds and beasts gathered on all sides, all shouting loudly, circled his corpse, and licked his blood from his chest.

source_sentence: 盲父母聞此音聲，益怖彷徉而住。
translation: When the blind parents heard this sound, they became frightened and wandered off.

source_sentence: 王行駛疾，觸動草木，肅肅有聲，父母驚言：『此是何人？
translation: As the king traveled quickly, he touched the grass and trees with a loud, solemn noise, and his parents were startled and said, 'Who is this man?'

source_sentence: 非我子行。』
translation: He's not my son's practice.'

source_sentence: 王言：『我是迦夷國王，聞盲道人在山學道，故來供養。』
translation: The king said, 'I'm the king of Kāsi, and I heard that a blind monk was training on the mountain, so I came to make offerings.'

source_sentence: 盲父母言：『枉屈大王來相慰勞，遠臨草野，王當疲極，體安隱不？
translation: The blind parents said, 'Have you wasted your time, Your Majesty, coming here to offer your comfort, for you must be so tired from being out in the hills and fields, won't you be at ease?'

source_sentence: 宮殿夫人、太子、官屬皆安善不？
translation: Are the ladies of the palace, the crown prince, and the officials all well?

source_sentence: 風雨和調五穀豐不？
translation: Are the winds and rain harmonizing and the grains abundant?

source_sentence: 隣國人民不相侵害耶？』
translation: Do the people of the neighboring countries not harm each other?'

source_sentence: 王答道人：『得蒙尊恩，常自平安。』
translation: The king answered the evangelist, 'I've been honored and have always been at peace.'

source_sentence: 又更問訊：『在此山中勞大勤苦，樹木之間，甚難為止，自安隱不？』
translation: Again, he asked, 'Do you work hard here in the mountains, where it's difficult to stop the suffering among the trees, and are you at peace?'

source_sentence: 盲父母言：『蒙大王恩，常自安隱，我有孝子，名字曰睒，常取果蓏泉水無乏；我有草蓆，王可就坐，果蓏可食。
translation: The blind parents said, 'By the grace of the king, I've always been at ease. I have a dutiful son named Glitter who always gets fruit and water from the springs without running out; I have a straw mat where the king can sit and fruit to eat.

source_sentence: 睒行取水，正爾來還。』
translation: He walks around fetching water, and just then he comes back.'

source_sentence: 「王聞盲父母言，又大傷心，涕泣其言：『我罪實重，入山射獵，遙見水邊有諸群鹿，引弓射之，箭誤中睒；道人子睒已被毒箭，其痛甚酷，今故自來語道人耳。』
translation: "When the king heard what his blind parents said, he was deeply distressed and wept, saying, 'My crime was really serious. I went into the mountains to shoot a deer, and I saw a herd of deer near the water.

source_sentence: 父母聞之，舉身自撲，如太山崩地為大動，號哭仰天，自陳訴言：『我子睒者，天下至孝，無有能過，蹈地常恐地痛，有何罪故而射殺之？
translation: When his parents heard this, they threw themselves up and threw themselves against him like a great mountain crumbling to the ground, cried out and looked up to heaven, and said, 'My son Glitter is the most dutiful person in the world, unsurpassed, and he always fears the pain of the ground when he steps on it.

source_sentence: 向者，大風卒起，吹折樹木，百鳥悲鳴，皆大號呼動一山中。
translation: A great wind suddenly arose, breaking trees and causing a hundred birds to cry out in pity, all shouting and moving up a mountain.

source_sentence: 我在山中二十餘年，未曾有此災異之變，而我子睒取水不還，恐當有故，諸神皆驚，肅肅而動。』
translation: I've been in the mountains for more than 20 years, and I've never seen such a catastrophic change, but my son glanced at the water and didn't return, so I'm afraid there must be a reason.

source_sentence: 母便涕哭，不肯復止，父言：『且止！
translation: His mother then burst into tears and refused to stop, but his father said, 'Stop!

source_sentence: 人生世間，無有不死？
translation: Is there nothing in this world that is immortal?

source_sentence: 無常對至，不可得却。』
translation: It's impermanent and arriving, and it's impossible to escape.'

source_sentence: 但問王：『睒為射何許，今為死活？』
translation: But he asked the king, 'Did he ever glance at the sky for permission to shoot, and now is he dead or alive?'

source_sentence: 王以睒語向父母說，其盲父母聞王此語，又大感絕：『一旦無子，俱亦當死。
translation: When the king spoke to his parents in glittering terms, their blind parents heard the king's words and were deeply moved, 'Once we have no children, we'll both die.'

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 今者牽我二人往子尸上。』
translation: Now, take us both and lead us to the corpse of our son.'

source_sentence: 「王即牽盲父母往到尸上，父抱其頭，母抱兩脚著膝上，各以兩手捫摸睒箭，仰天呼言：『諸天龍神、山神、樹神，我子睒者，天下至孝，是諸天龍神所知。
translation: "The king then led his blind parents to the corpse, put his father's arm around his head and his mother's arm around his knees, each touched the glittering arrow with his two hands, and called up to heaven, saying, 'The gods of the gods, the gods of the mountains and the gods of the trees, my son Glitter is the most filial person in the world and is known to the gods, the dragons, and the gods.

source_sentence: 我年已老，目無所見，身代子死，睒活不恨。』
translation: I'm old and can't see with my eyes; I'll die in my son's place, but I won't hate him if I glance at him alive.'

source_sentence: 於是，父母俱共誓言：『若睒至孝天地所知，箭當拔出，毒痛當除，睒應更生。』
translation: Then, both parents vowed together, 'If Glance is most dutiful and known to heaven and earth, the arrow will be removed, the pain will be removed, and Glance will be reborn.'

source_sentence: 「於是，第二忉利天帝座即為動，以眼見此二盲道人抱子號呼，乃聞第四兜率天上，釋梵四王從天上來，如人屈伸之頃，來住睒前，以神妙藥灌睒口中，藥入睒口，箭拔毒出，更生如故。
translation: "They then heard from the fourth Tuṣita Heaven that the four Śākyamuni kings had come from heaven and stayed in front of the Śākyamuni like men in a state of flexion and extension. They poured a wonderful medicine into the Śākyamuni's mouth, which removed the poison from the arrows and revived him as before.

source_sentence: 父母聞睒已死更生，兩目皆開，飛鳥、走獸皆大歡樂之音，風息雲消日為重光，流泉涌出清而且涼，池中蓮華五色精明，栴檀雜香，樹木光榮，香倍於常。
translation: When his parents heard that he had been reborn from the dead, his two eyes were opened, the birds and animals made loud, joyful noises, the wind calmed and the clouds disappeared, the sun shone brightly again, the streams and springs welled up clear and cool, the lotus in the pond was five-colored and brilliant, the sandalwood was mixed with fragrance, and the trees were glorious and their fragrance was twice as great as usual.

source_sentence: 時王歡喜不能自勝，禮天帝釋，還禮父母及子睒者：『願以一國所有財寶，俱上道人自相供養，令我罪滅永無有餘。』
translation: The king then rejoiced beyond measure, paid homage to Indra, returned to his parents, and paid homage to his son Glancey, saying, 'May I offer all the wealth and treasure of a single country to all the people of the Way, so that my sins may be ended and there may be no more.'

source_sentence: 睒語王言：『欲興福者，王但還國，安慰人民，當令奉戒；王勿射獵，橫殺無辜，身不安隱，壽終當入泥犁之中。
translation: He said to the king, 'Those who want to promote goodness, the king should simply return to his country, comfort the people, and make them observe the precepts; the king mustn't shoot or hunt, and he'll kill innocent people and leave his body unharmed; at the end of his life, he'll be put into a mudhole.

source_sentence: 人居世間恩愛暫有，別離長久不得常在，王宿有福今得為王，莫憍自在，以自在故，造無量惡，後入惡道，悔之何益。』
translation: People who live in the world have temporary affection and love, but they're separated for a long time and can't remain forever. The king was blessed in the past and has now become king; don't be proud of your independence; because of your independence, you'll do measureless evil and later enter a bad path; what good will it do to repent?'

source_sentence: 王答：『如教。』
translation: The king replied, 'As you were taught.'

source_sentence: 隨王獵者，見睒死已，得天神藥死而更生，父母眼開神變如是，悉奉五戒、修行十善，死得生天，無入惡道。」
translation: Those who follow the king's hunter will see Cao die and then obtain the goddess of medicine to revive them after death, and their parents' eyes will be opened and their miracles will be like this. They all observe the five precepts and cultivate the ten good qualities, and they'll be born in heaven after death and won't enter a bad path."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「諸來會者！
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "Those who come to the assembly!

source_sentence: 宿命睒者，吾身是也；盲父者，閱頭檀王是；盲母者，今王夫人摩耶是也；迦夷國王者，阿難是；天帝釋者，彌勒佛是。」
translation: The Śākyamuni who was glittering in his previous life is myself; the blind father is King Vṛhatphala; the blind mother is the present-day king's wife, Māya; the king of Kāśyapa is Ānanda; and the Śakra who is Maitreya Buddha."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「吾前世，為子仁孝、為君慈育、為民奉敬，自致得成為三界尊。」
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "In a previous life, I was kind and filial to my sons, loving and nurturing to my ruler, and respectful to the people, and I was able to become an honored member of the three worlds."

source_sentence: 佛說經已，時諸菩薩、比丘、比丘尼、優婆塞、優婆夷莫不歡喜，作禮而去。
translation: After the Buddha spoke the sūtra, the bodhisattvas, monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen rejoiced, paid homage, and departed.

source_sentence: 佛說睒子經
translation: Foshuo xiaozi jing
